programme.title: Accomplice to Murder, With Vinnie Politan
programme.sub-title: TN v. Turner: The Deadly Game
programme.desc: The murder of hometown NBA player, Lorenzen Wright remains unsolved until alleged accomplice Jimmy Martin reveals the location of the murder weapon, implicating Wright's ex-wife Sherra and her yardman Billy Ray Turner.

programme.title: Accomplice to Murder, With Vinnie Politan
programme.sub-title: FL v. Schulhoff: Romeo and Juliet in Central Florida
programme.desc: In a modern-day tale of Romeo and Juliet with a Florida twist, high schoolers Courtney Schulhoff and Michael Morin find solace in each other amidst a tumultuous family life; when their families force them apart the couple's desperation turns deadly.

programme.title: Accomplice to Murder, With Vinnie Politan
programme.sub-title: VT v. Durenleau: Last Call at Veronica's Tavern
programme.desc: In the peaceful village of Essex Junction, Vermont, Michael Durenleau's life is cut short with a knife through the heart in the darkness behind Veronica's Tavern after celebratory drinks with his wife Rebecca.

programme.title: Accomplice to Murder, With Vinnie Politan
programme.sub-title: MI v. Vander Ark - Monsters In Plain Sight
programme.desc: In a case that shocked the nation, a mother and son stand trial for the unthinkable; Shanda Vander Ark, once a promising law clerk, now faces murder charges in the death of her own child.

programme.title: FL v. Dalia Dippolito
programme.desc: The State brought in evidence of Dalia's alleged attempts to bring down Michael; investigators said her first plan was to get him sent back to jail.

programme.title: FL v. Dalia Dippolito
programme.desc: Police officers testified that they answered calls about drugs and domestic disturbances relating to Michael and Dalia Dippolito.

programme.title: FL v. Dalia Dippolito
programme.desc: The state presented items from a safe deposit box linked to Dalia's bank account.

programme.title: FL v. Dalia Dippolito
programme.desc: Dalia is accused of stealing tens of thousands of dollars from Michael while they were dating.

programme.title: FL v. Dalia Dippolito
programme.desc: The jury learned more about financial transactions during the short-lived marriage of Dalia and Michael Dippolito.

programme.title: FL v. Dalia Dippolito
programme.sub-title: Plotting to Get Rid of Her New Husband
programme.desc: Dalia Dippolito had tried to kill her Michael twice before; she was of accused of trying to poison him.

programme.title: FL v. Dalia Dippolito
programme.desc: Dalia Dippolito's confidential informant testified via video in the trial; he said that Dalia offered to pay him to kill her husband.

programme.title: FL v. Dalia Dippolito
programme.desc: A month before the trial, a key State witness testified on video which jurors watched in court.

programme.title: Corn Rake Murder Trial
programme.desc: The defense gives their opening remarks to jurors, claiming that Amy Mullis was found dead on the family's hog farm; Todd and his oldest son found her face down with a corn rake sticking out of her back.

programme.title: Corn Rake Murder Trial
programme.desc: Amy Mullis' brother tells the jurors that she was unhappy in her marriage and had plans to divorce Todd and move out; the oldest son of Todd and Amy Mullis testifies; Trysten was the one who found Amy unresponsive in a shed on the family's farm.

programme.title: Corn Rake Murder Trial
programme.desc: Jurors hear about the moments before and after the death of Amy Mullis; Trysten gives a timeline of events that includes his discovery of his mom in a shed and helping his dad to get her to a hospital; he recalls the time he lost sight of his dad.

programme.title: Corn Rake Murder Trial
programme.desc: Todd Mullis' son testifies about the moment his father pulled the corn rake out of his mother's back; the 911 call plays in court; Todd did not make that call immediately; he called for help when he and his son were trying to get to the hospital.

programme.title: Corn Rake Murder Trial
programme.desc: The first responding officer to Amy Mullis' death takes the stand; the deputy sheriff claims Todd was not showing a lot of emotion; Jurors are presented with crime scene photos.

programme.title: Corn Rake Murder Trial
programme.sub-title: Four Tines But Six Puncture Wounds
programme.desc: The chief medical examiner takes the stand; Dr. Craig Thompson was on duty in the ER when Amy arrived in an ambulance; Dr. Thompson noted how Amy not only had six puncture wounds in her back, but she had wounds on her face.

programme.title: Corn Rake Murder Trial
programme.desc: Jurors learn more about Amy Mullis' infidelity in her 14-year marriage to Todd; according to her friend on the stand, Todd began to be more controlling after her first affair; Terri Staner testifies that he forced her to quit her job.

programme.title: Corn Rake Murder Trial
programme.desc: A friend who had insights into the marriage of Todd and Amy Mullis has more to tell the jury about the weeks leading up to Amy's death; prosecutors are convinced that Todd killed his wife because she was going to leave him for her lover.

programme.title: Corn Rake Murder Trial
programme.sub-title: Fatal Attack By A Corn Rake
programme.desc: A close friend of Amy Mullis tells the jury that Amy had an affair with the field manager working at their family farm; forensic pathologist Dr. Kelly Kruse testifies that a sharp force injury to the torso was the cause of Amy's death.

programme.title: Corn Rake Murder Trial
programme.sub-title: Amy Mullis's Lover Takes The Stand
programme.desc: The prosecution brought in Amy Mullis' lover to testify for the jury; he happened to be a field manager at the Mullis' family hog farm, where he and Amy first met; Jerry Frasher claims that Amy was not happy in her marriage.

programme.title: Corn Rake Murder Trial
programme.desc: Amy Mullis's close friends testify against her husband, Todd; the State wanted those close to Amy to share their inside knowledge about their marriage and her affair; prosecutors claim that the affair ultimately led to her death.

programme.title: Corn Rake Murder Trial
programme.desc: Prosecutors bring in the investigators who've worked extensively on the case; officers were suspicious of Todd's initial claim that Amy Mullis somehow accidentally fell on an upended corn rake.

programme.title: The Case Against Bryan Kohberger
programme.desc: A look at the evidence against Bryan Kohberger, accused of murdering four University of Idaho students in their off-campus home, including DNA, video surveillance and cell phone data.
